newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Optus to spend A$300 mln on mobile network.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Optus to spend A$300 mln on mobile network.

text.p: Optus Communications Pty Ltd said on Tuesday it would invest about A$300 million in its digital mobile phone network to expand digital coverage to equal the analogue mobile network's 91 percent coverage of Australiam population before the end of 1997.

Optus said the planned investment comprises a A$65 million investment in expanding Optus mobile digital coverage as well as another A$235 million cash injection into infrastructure supporting the company GSM network.
This would allow Optus to increase the capacity of its mobile network to support market growth up to the year 2000.

"This planned A$300 million investment into our GSM network allows Optus to achieve two objectives - it prepares us for the closure of the analogue mobile phone network in the year 2000 and it expands the capacity of the network for customer growth," Optus operating officer Phil Jacobs said in a statement.

"Optus is currently in discussions with Austel, the Spectrum Managament Agency, consumer groups and the government to help decide how the closure of analogue should take place," Jacobs said. Optus plans a sharemarket float by the end of the year.
The company is 25 percent owned by Mayne Nickless Ltd and 24.5 percent each by BellSouth Corp of the United States and Cable and Wireless Plc of Britain.
Australian institutional investors own the rest.
